summary.long: Mark is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The beginning of the Gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As it is written in the Prophets, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness, is, Prepare the way of the Lord: make his paths straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John did baptize in the wilderness, and preach the baptism of amendment of life, for remission of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the country of Judea, and they of Jerusalem went out unto him, and were all baptized of him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now John was clothed with camel’s hair, and with a girdle of a skin about his loins: and he did eat locusts and wild honey,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And preached, saying, A stronger than I cometh after me, whose shoe’s latchet I am not worthy to stoop down, and unloose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truth it is, I have baptized you with water: but he will baptize you with the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth, a city of Galilee, and was baptized of John in Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as he was come out of the water, John saw the heavens cloven in twain, and the holy Ghost descending upon him like a dove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there was a voice from heaven, saying, Thou art my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was there in the wilderness forty days, and was tempted of Satan: he was also with the wild beasts, and the Angels ministered unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after that John was committed to prison, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the Gospel of the kingdom of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And saying, The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent and believe the Gospel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And as he walked by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea (for they were fishers.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, Follow me, and I will make you to be fishers of men.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And straightway they forsook their nets, and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had gone a little further thence, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, as they were in the ship, mending their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And anon he called them: and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with his hired servants, and went their way after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they entered into Capernaum: and straightway on the Sabbath day he entered into the Synagogue, and taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were astonied at his doctrine, for he taught them as one that had authority, and not as the Scribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was in their Synagogue a man in whom was an unclean spirit, and he cried out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Ah, what have we to do with thee, O Jesus of Nazareth? Art thou come to destroy us? I know thee what thou art, even thou holy one of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the unclean spirit tare him, and cried with a loud voice, and came out of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were all amazed, so that they demanded one of another, saying, What thing is this? what new doctrine is this? for he commandeth even the foul spirits with authority, and they obey him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region bordering on Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as they were come out of the Synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick of a fever, and anon they told him of her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came and took her by the hand, and lifted her up, and the fever forsook her by and by, and she ministered unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when even was come, at what time the Sun setteth, they brought to him all that were diseased, and them that were possessed with devils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole city was gathered together at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases: and he cast out many devils, and suffered not the devils to say that they knew him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning very early before day, Jesus arose and went out into a solitary place, and there prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon, and they that were with him, followed carefully after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had found him, they said unto him, All men seek for thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto them, Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there also: for I came out for that purpose.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he preached in their Synagogues, throughout all Galilee, and cast the devils out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came a leper to him, beseeching him, and kneeled down unto him, and said to him, If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus had compassion, and put forth his hand, and touched him, and said to him, I will: be thou clean.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And as soon as he had spoken, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was made clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had given him a straight commandment, he sent him away forthwith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto him, See thou say nothing to any man, but get thee hence, and show thyself to the Priest, and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded, for a testimonial unto them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when he was departed, he began to tell many things, and to publish the matter: so that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city, but was without in desert places: and they came to him from every quarter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After a few days, he entered into Capernaum again, and it was noised that he was in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And anon many gathered together, insomuch, that the places about the door could not receive any more: and he preached the word unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came unto him, that brought one sick of the palsy, borne of four men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because they could not come near unto him for the multitude, they uncovered the roof of the house where he was: and when they had broken it open, they let down the bed, wherein the sick of the palsy lay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus saw their faith, he said to the sick of the palsy, Son, thy sins are forgiven thee.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And there were certain of the Scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why doth this man speak such blasphemies? who can forgive sins, but God only?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately, when Jesus perceived in his spirit, that thus they reasoned with themselves, he said unto them, Why reason ye these things in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy, Thy sins are forgiven thee? or to say, Arise, take up thy bed, and walk?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But that ye may know, that the Son of man hath authority in earth to forgive sins, he said unto the sick of the palsy,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy bed, and get thee hence into thine own house.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And by and by he arose, and took up his bed, and went forth before them all, insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw such a thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went forth again toward the sea, and all the people resorted unto him, and he taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Jesus passed by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sit at the receipt of custom, and said unto him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And it came to pass, as Jesus sat at table in his house, many Publicans and sinners sat at table also with Jesus, and his disciples: for there were many that followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with the Publicans and sinners, they said unto his disciples, How is it, that he eateth and drinketh with Publicans and sinners?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus heard it, he said unto them, The whole have no need of the Physician, but the sick. I came not to call the righteous, but the sinners to repentance.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the disciples of John, and the Pharisees did fast, and came and said unto him, Why do the disciples of John, and of the Pharisees fast, and thy disciples fast not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the marriage chamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken from them, and then shall they fast in those days.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Also no man soweth a piece of new cloth in an old garment: for else the new piece that filled it up, taketh away somewhat from the old, and the breach is worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, no man putteth new wine into old vessels: for else the new wine breaketh the vessels, and the wine runneth out, and the vessels are lost; but new wine must be put into new vessels.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And it came to pass as he went through the corn on the Sabbath day, that his disciples, as they went on their way, began to pluck the ears of corn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisees said unto him, Behold, why do they on the Sabbath day, that which is not lawful?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, Have ye never read what David did when he had need, and was an hungered, both he, and they that were with him?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: How he went into the house of God, in the days of Abiathar the high Priest, and did eat the Showbread, which were not lawful to eat, but for the Priests, and gave also to them which were with him?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he said to them, The Sabbath was made for man, and not man for the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Wherefore the Son of man is Lord, even of the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he entered again into the Synagogue, and there was a man which had a withered hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they watched him, whether he would heal him on the Sabbath day, that they might accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto the man which had the withered hand, Arise: stand forth in the midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, Is it lawful to do a good deed on the Sabbath day, or to do evil? to save the life, or to kill? but they held their peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he looked round about on them angrily, mourning also for the hardness of their hearts, and said to the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched it out: and his hand was restored, as whole as the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisees departed, and straightway gathered a council with the Herodians against him, that they might destroy him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus avoided with his disciples to the sea: and a great multitude followed him from Galilee, and from Judea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from Jerusalem, and from Idumea, and beyond Jordan: and they that dwelled about Tyre and Sidon, when they had heard what great things he did, came unto him in great number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded his disciples, that a little ship should wait for him, because of the multitude, lest they should throng him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he had healed many, insomuch that they pressed upon him to touch him, as many as had plagues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the unclean spirits saw him, they fell down before him, and cried, saying, Thou art the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sharply rebuked them, to the end they should not utter him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went up into a mountain, and called unto him whom he would, and they came unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he appointed twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them to preach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that they might have power to heal sicknesses, and to cast out devils:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the first was Simon, and he named Simon, Peter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then James the son of Zebedee, and John James’ brother (and surnamed them Boanerges, which is, The sons of thunder.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Canaanite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him, and they came home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitude assembled again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his kinsfolks heard of it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said that he was beside himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Scribes which came down from Jerusalem, said, He hath Beelzebub, and through the prince of the devils he casteth out devils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he called them unto him, and said unto them in parables, How can Satan drive out Satan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot continue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if Satan make insurrection against himself, and be divided, he cannot endure, but is at an end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man can enter into a strong man’s house, and take away his goods, except he first bind that strong man, and then spoil his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, all sins shall be forgiven unto the children of men, and blasphemies, wherewith they blaspheme:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that blasphemeth against the holy Ghost, shall never have forgiveness, but is culpable of eternal damnation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because they said, He had an unclean spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came his brethren and mother and stood without, and sent unto him, and called him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother, and thy brethren seek for thee without.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered them, saying, Who is my mother and my brethren?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he looked round about on them, which sat in compass about him, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever doeth the will of God, he is my brother, my sister, and my mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began again to teach by the seaside, and there gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea, and all the people was by the seaside on the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he taught them many things in parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearken: Behold, there went out a sower to sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass as he sowed, that some fell by the wayside, and the fowls of the heaven came, and devoured it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth, and by and by sprang up, because it had not depth of earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as soon as the Sun was up, it was burnt up, and because it had not root, it withered away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, so that it gave no fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some again fell in good ground, and did yield fruit that sprung up, and grew, and it brought forth, some thirtyfold, some sixtyfold, and some an hundredfold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto them, He that hath ears, to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve, asked him of the parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, To you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all things be done in parables,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That they seeing, may see, and not discern: and they hearing, may hear, and not understand, lest at any time they should turn, and their sins should be forgiven them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he said unto them, Perceive ye not this parable? how then should ye understand all other parables?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sower soweth the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are they that receive the seed by the wayside, in whom the word is sown: but when they have heard it, Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And likewise they that receive the seed in stony ground, are they, which when they have heard the word, straightway receive it with gladness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet have they no root in themselves, and endure but a time: for when trouble and persecution ariseth for the word, immediately they be offended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also they that receive the seed among the thorns, are such as hear the word:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things enter in, and choke the word, and it is unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they that have received seed in good ground, are they that hear the word, and receive it, and bring forth fruit: one corn thirty, another sixty, and some an hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also he said unto them, Cometh the candle in, to be put under a bushel, or under the bed, and not to be put in a candlestick?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is nothing hid, that shall not be opened, neither is there a secret, but that it shall come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear. With what measure you mete, it shall be measured unto you: and unto you that hear, shall more be given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For unto him that hath, shall it be given, and from him that hath not, shall be taken away even that he hath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also he said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed in the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And should sleep, and rise up night and day, and the seed should spring and grow up, he not knowing how.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of itself, first the blade, then the ears, after that full corn in the ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as the fruit showeth itself, anon he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said moreover, Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which when it is sown in the earth, is the least of all seeds that be in the earth:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after that it is sown, it groweth up, and is greatest of all herbs, and beareth great branches, so that the fowls of the heaven may build under the shadow of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with many such parables he preached the word unto them, as they were able to hear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And without parables spake he nothing unto them: but he expounded all things to his disciples apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the same day when even was come, he said unto them, Let us pass over unto the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they left the multitude, and took him as he was in the ship, and there was also with him other little ships.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves dashed into the ship, so that it was now full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was in the stern asleep on a pillow: and they awoke him, and said to him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he arose up, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, and be still. So the wind ceased, and it was a great calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, Who is this, that both the wind and sea obey him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came over to the other side of the sea into the country of the Gadarenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come out of the ship, there met him incontinently out of the graves, a man which had an unclean spirit:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who had his abiding among the graves, and no man could bind him, no not with chains:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because that when he was often bound with fetters and chains, he plucked the chains asunder, and brake the fetters in pieces, neither could any man tame him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And always both night and day he cried in the mountains, and in the graves, and struck himself with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw Jesus afar off, he ran, and worshipped him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And cried with a loud voice, and said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus the Son of the most High God? I will that thou swear to me by God, that thou torment me not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For he said unto him, Come out of the man, thou unclean spirit.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he asked him, What is thy name? and he answered, saying, My name is Legion: for we are many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he prayed him instantly, that he would not send them away out of the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was there in the mountains a great heard of swine, feeding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the devils besought him, saying, Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And incontinently Jesus gave them leave. Then the unclean spirits went out and entered into the swine, and the herd ran headlong from the high bank into the sea, (and there were about two thousand swine) and they were choked up in the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the swineherds fled, and told it in the city, and in the country, and they came out to see what it was that was done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Jesus, and saw him that had been possessed with the devil, and had the legion, sit both clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that saw it, told them, what was done to him that was possessed with the devil, and concerning the swine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they began to pray him, that he would depart from their coasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come into the ship, he that had been possessed with the devil, prayed him that he might be with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howbeit, Jesus would not suffer him, but said unto him, Go thy way home to thy friends, and show them what great things the Lord hath done unto thee, and how he hath had compassion on thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he departed, and began to publish in Decapolis, what great things Jesus had done unto him: and all men did marvel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus was come over again by ship unto the other side, a great multitude gathered together to him, and he was near unto the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there came one of the rulers of the Synagogue, whose name was Jairus: and when he saw him, he fell down at his feet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And besought him instantly, saying, My little daughter lieth at point of death: I pray thee that thou wouldest come and lay thine hands on her, that she may be healed, and live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went with him, and a great multitude followed him and thronged him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And there was a certain woman, which was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And had suffered many things of many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and it availed her nothing, but she became much worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she had heard of Jesus, she came in the press behind, and touched his garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For she said, if I may but touch his clothes, I shall be whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And straightway the course of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body, that she was healed of that plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately when Jesus did know in himself the virtue that went out of him, he turned him round about in the press, and said, Who hath touched my clothes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude throng thee, and sayest thou, Who did touch me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he looked round about, to see her that had done that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the woman feared and trembled: for she knew what was done in her, and she came and fell down before him, and told him the whole truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole: go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he yet spake, there came from the same ruler of the Synagogue’s house certain which said, Thy daughter is dead: why diseasest thou the master any further?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Jesus heard that word spoken, he said unto the ruler of the Synagogue, Be not afraid: only believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he suffered no man to follow him save Peter and James, and John the brother of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he came unto the house of the ruler of the Synagogue, and saw the tumult, and them that wept and wailed greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went in, and said unto them, Why make ye this trouble, and weep? the child is not dead, but sleepeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they laughed him to scorn: but he put them all out, and took the father, and the mother of the child, and them that were with him, and entered in where the child lay,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And took the child by the hand, and said unto her, Talitha cumi, which is by interpretation, Maiden, I say unto thee, arise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And straightway the maiden arose, and walked: for she was of the age of twelve years, and they were astonied out of measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he charged them straitly that no man should know of it, and commanded to give her meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he departed thence, and came into his own country, and his disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Sabbath was come, he began to teach in the Synagogue, and many that heard him, were astonied, and said, From whence hath this man these things? and what wisdom is this that is given unto him, that even such great works are done by his hands?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not this that carpenter Mary’s son, the brother of James and Joses, and of Judas and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, A Prophet is not without honor, but in his own country, and among his own kindred, and in his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he could there do no great works, save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk, and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he marveled at their unbelief, and went about by the towns on every side, teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called unto him the twelve, and began to send them forth two and two, and gave them power over unclean spirits,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey, save a staff only: neither scrip, neither bread, neither money in their girdles:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that they should be shod with sandals, and that they should not put on two coats,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Wheresoever ye shall enter into an house, there abide till ye depart thence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust that is under your feet, for a witness unto them. Verily I say unto you, It shall be easier for Sodom, or Gomorrah at the day of Judgment, than for that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went out, and preached, that men should amend their lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cast out many devils: and they anointed many that were sick, with oil, and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Herod heard of him (for his Name was made manifest) and said, John Baptist is risen again from the dead, and therefore great works are wrought by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, It is Elijah, and some said, It is a Prophet, or as one of those Prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Herod heard it, he said, It is John whom I beheaded: he is risen from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod himself had sent forth, and had taken John, and bound him in prison for Herodias’ sake, which was his brother Philip’s wife, because he had married her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John said unto Herod, It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Herodias laid wait against him: and would have killed him, but she could not:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just man, and an holy, and reverenced him, and when he heard him, he did many things, and heard him gladly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the time being convenient, when Herod on his birthday made a banquet to his princes and captains, and chief estates of Galilee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the daughter of the same Herodias came in, and danced, and pleased Herod, and them that sat at table together, the King said unto the maid, Ask of me what thou wilt, and I will give it thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he swore unto her, Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me, I will give it thee, even unto the half of my kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she went forth, and said to her mother, What shall I ask? And she said, John Baptist’s head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she came in straightway with haste unto the King, and asked, saying, I would that thou shouldest give me even now in a charger the head of John Baptist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the King was very sorry: yet for his oath’s sake, and for their sakes which sat at table with him, he would not refuse her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately the King sent the hangman, and gave charge that his head should be brought in. So he went and beheaded him in the prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And brought his head in a charger, and gave it to the maid, and the maid gave it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his disciples heard it, they came and took up his body, and put it in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Apostles gathered themselves together to Jesus, and told him all things, both what they had done, and what they had taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Come ye apart into the wilderness, and rest a while: for there were many comers and goers, that they had not leisure to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went by ship out of the way into a desert place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people saw them when they departed, and many knew him, and ran afoot thither out of all cities, and came thither before them, and assembled unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went out, and saw a great multitude, and had compassion on them, because they were like sheep which had no shepherd: and he began to teach them many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the day was now far spent, his disciples came unto him, saying, This is a desert place, and now the day is far passed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them depart, that they may go into the country and towns about, and buy them bread: for they have nothing to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, and said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they said unto him, Shall we go, and buy two hundred pennies worth of bread, and give them to eat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto them, How many loaves have ye? go and look. And when they knew it, they said, Five, and two fishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he commanded them to make them all sit down by companies upon the green grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sat down by rows, by hundreds, and by fifties.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took the five loaves, and the two fishes, and looked up to heaven, and gave thanks, and broke the loaves, and gave them to his disciples to set before them, and the two fishes he divided among them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they did all eat, and were satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments, and of the fishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that had eaten, were about five thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And straightway he caused his disciples to go into the ship, and to go before unto the other side unto Bethsaida, while he sent away the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then as soon as he had sent them away, he departed into a mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when even was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saw them troubled in rowing, (for the wind was contrary unto them) and about the fourth watch of the night, he came unto them, walking upon the sea, and would have passed by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw him walking upon the sea, they supposed it had been a spirit, and cried out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they all saw him, and were sore afraid: but anon he talked with them, and said unto them, Be ye of good comfort: it is I, be not afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went up unto them into the ship, and the wind ceased, and they were much more amazed in themselves, and marveled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they had not considered the matter of the loaves, because their hearts were hardened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came over, and went into the land of Gennesaret, and arrived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they were come out of the ship, straightway they knew him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ran about throughout all that region round about, and began to carry hither and thither in couches all that were sick, where they heard that he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whithersoever he entered into towns, or cities, or villages, they laid their sick in the streets, and prayed him that they might touch at the least the edge of his garment. And as many as touched him, were made whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then gathered unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the Scribes which came from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw some of his disciples eat meat with common hands, (that is to say, unwashen) they complained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash their hands oft, eat not, holding the traditions of the Elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they come from the market, except they wash, they eat not: and many other things there be, which they have taken upon them to observe, as the washing of cups, and pots, and of brazen vessels, and of beds.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then asked him the Pharisees and Scribes, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the Elders, but eat meat with unwashen hands?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he answered and said unto them, Surely Isaiah hath prophesied well of you, hypocrites, as it is written, This people honoreth me with lips, but their heart is far away from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they worship me in vain, teaching for doctrines the commandments of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye lay the Commandments of God apart, and observe the tradition of men, as the washing of pots and of cups, and many other such like things ye do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Well ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may observe your own tradition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses said, Honor thy father and thy mother: and Whosoever shall speak evil of father or mother, let him die the death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye say, If a man say to father or mother, Corban, that is, By the gift that is offered by me, thou mayest have profit, he shall be free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So ye suffer him no more to do anything for his father, or his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Making the word of God of none authority, by your tradition which ye have ordained: and ye do many such like things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he calleth the whole multitude unto him, and said unto them, Hearken you all unto me, and understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is nothing without a man, that can defile him, when it entereth into him: but the things which proceed out of him, are they which defile the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any have ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came into an house, away from the people, his disciples asked him concerning the parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, What? are ye without understanding also? Do ye not know that whatsoever thing from without entereth into a man, cannot defile him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because it entered not into his heart, but into the belly, and goeth out into the draught which is the purging of all meats?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, That which cometh out of man, that defileth man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from within, even out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, uncleanness, a wicked eye, backbiting, pride, foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these evil things come from within, and defile a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from thence he rose, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and entered into an house, and would that no man should have known: but he could not be hid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a certain woman, whose little daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of him, and came, and fell at his feet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And the woman was a Greek, a Syro-Phoenician by nation) and she besought him that he would cast out the devil out of her daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said unto her, Let the children first be fed: for it is not good to take the children’s bread, and to cast it unto whelps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she answered, and said unto him, Truth, Lord: yet indeed the whelps eat under the table of the children’s crumbs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto her, For this saying go thy way: the devil is gone out of thy daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she was come home to her house, she found the devil departed, and her daughter lying on the bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he departed again from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon, and came unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought unto him one that was deaf and stammered in his speech, and prayed him to put his hand upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took him aside from the multitude, and put his fingers in his ears, and did spit, and touched his tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And looking up to heaven, he sighed, and said unto him, Ephphatha, that is, Be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And straightway his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded them that they should tell no man: but how much soever he forbade them, the more a great deal they published it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And were beyond measure astonied, saying, He hath done all things well: He maketh both the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days, when there was a very great multitude, and had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to him, and said unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now continued with me three days, and have nothing to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I send them away fasting to their own houses, they would faint by the way: for some of them came from far.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his disciples answered him, Whence can a man satisfy these with bread here in the wilderness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he asked them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground: and he took the seven loaves, and gave thanks, brake them, and gave to his disciples to set before them, and they did set them before the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had also a few small fishes: and when he had given thanks, he commanded them also to be set before them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they did eat, and were sufficed, and they took up of the broken meat that was left, seven baskets full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And they that had eaten, were about four thousand) so he sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And anon he entered into a ship with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisees came forth, and began to dispute with him, seeking of him a sign from heaven, and tempting him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sighed deeply in his spirit, and said, Why doth this generation seek a sign? Verily I say unto you, a sign shall not be given unto this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he left them, and went into the ship again, and departed to the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they had forgotten to take bread, neither had they in the ship with them, but one loaf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he charged them, saying, Take heed, and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, and of the leaven of Herod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, It is, because we have no bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus knew it, he said unto them, Why reason you thus, because ye have no bread? perceive ye not yet, neither understand? have ye your hearts yet hardened?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have ye eyes, and see not? and have ye ears, and hear not? and do ye not remember?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand, how many baskets full of broken meat took ye up? They said unto him, Twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when I brake seven among four thousand, how many baskets full of the leavings of broken meat took ye up? And they said, Seven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto them, How is it that ye understand not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to Bethsaida, and they brought a blind man unto him, and desired him to touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took the blind by the hand, and led him out of the town, and spat in his eyes, and put his hands upon him, and asked him, if he saw ought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he looked up, and said, I see men: for I see them walking like trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, he put his hands again upon his eyes, and made him look again. And he was restored to his sight, and saw every man afar off clearly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent him home to his house, saying, Neither go into the town, nor tell it to any in the town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went out, and his disciples into the towns of Caesarea Philippi. And by the way he asked his disciples, saying unto them, Whom do men say that I am?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answered, Some say, John Baptist: and some, Elijah: and some, one of the Prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, But whom say ye that I am? Then Peter answered, and said unto him, Thou art that Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sharply charged them, that concerning him they should tell no man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to teach them that the son of man must suffer many things, and should be reproved of the Elders, and of the high Priests, and of the Scribes, and be slain, and within three days rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake that thing boldly. Then Peter took him aside, and began to rebuke him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he turned back and looked on his disciples, and rebuked Peter, saying, Get thee behind me, Satan: for thou understandest not the things that are of God, but the things that are of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called the people unto him with his disciples, and said unto them, Whosoever will follow me, let him forsake himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever will save his life, shall lose it: but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the Gospel’s, he shall save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what shall it profit a man, though he should win the whole world, if he lose his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what exchange shall a man give for his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever shall be ashamed of me, and of my words among this adulterous and sinful generation, of him shall the Son of man be ashamed also, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy Angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, that there be some of them that stand here, which shall not taste of death till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And six days after, Jesus taketh unto him Peter, and James, and John, and carrieth them up into an high mountain out of the way alone, and his shape was changed before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his raiment did shine, and was very white as snow, so white as no fuller can make upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there appeared unto them Elijah with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter answered, and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: let us make also three tabernacles, one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet he knew not what he said: for they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a cloud that shadowed them, and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly they looked round about, and saw no more any man save Jesus only with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they came down from the mountain, he charged them, that they should tell no man what they had seen, save when the Son of man were risen from the dead again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they kept that matter to themselves, and demanded one of another, what the rising from the dead again should mean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also they asked him, saying, Why say the Scribes, that Elijah must first come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered, and said unto them, Elijah verily shall first come, and restore all things: and as it is written of the Son of man, he must suffer many things, and be set at nought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say unto you, that Elijah is come, (and they have done unto him whatsoever they would) as it is written of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came to his disciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the Scribes disputing with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were amazed, and ran to him, and saluted him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he asked the Scribes, What dispute you among yourselves?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of the company answered, and said, Master, I have brought my son unto thee, which hath a dumb spirit:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And wheresoever he taketh him, he teareth him, and he foameth, and gnasheth his teeth, and pineth away: and I spake to thy disciples, that they should cast him out, and they could not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he answered him, and said, O faithless generation, how long now shall I be with you! how long now shall I suffer you! Bring him unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought him unto him: and as soon as the spirit saw him, he tare him, and he fell down on the ground wallowing and foaming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he asked his father, How long time is it since he hath been thus? And he said, Of a child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And oft times he casteth him into the fire, and into the water to destroy him: but if thou canst do anything, help us, and have compassion upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, If thou canst believe it, all things are possible to him that believeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And straightway the father of the child crying with tears, said, Lord, I believe: help my unbelief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that the people came running together, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying unto him, Thou dumb and deaf spirit, I charge thee come out of him, and enter no more into him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the spirit cried, and rent him sore, and came out, and he was as one dead, insomuch that many said, He is dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus took his hand, and lifted him up, and he arose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him secretly, Why could not we cast him out?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, This kind can by no other means come forth, but by prayer and fasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed thence, and went together through Galilee, and he would not that any should have known it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he taught his disciples, and said unto them, The Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men, and they shall kill him, but after that he is killed, he shall rise again the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they understood not that saying, and were afraid to ask him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After, he came to Capernaum: and when he was in the house, he asked them, What was it that ye disputed among you by the way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they held their peace: for by the way they reasoned among themselves, who should be the chiefest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sat down and called the twelve, and said to them, If any man desire to be first, the same shall be last of all, and servant unto all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took a little child, and set him in the midst of them, and took him in his arms, and said unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever shall receive one of such little children in my Name, receiveth me: and whosoever receiveth me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then John answered him, saying, Master, we saw one casting out devils by thy Name, which followeth not us, and we forbade him, because he followeth us not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, Forbid him not: for there is no man that can do a miracle by my Name, that can lightly speak evil of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever is not against us, is on our part.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink for my Name’s sake, because ye belong to Christ, verily I say unto you, he shall not lose his reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever shall offend one of these little ones, that believe in me, it were better for him rather, that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and that he were cast into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore if thine hand cause thee to offend, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter into life, maimed, than having two hands, to go into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire never goeth out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, if thy foot cause thee to offend, cut it off: it is better for thee to go halt into life, than having two feet, to be cast into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire never goeth out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if thine eye cause thee to offend, pluck it out: it is better for thee to go into the kingdom of God with one eye, than having two eyes, to be cast into hell fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire never goeth out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every man shall be salted with fire: and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salt is good: but if the salt be unsavory, wherewith shall it be seasoned? have salt in yourselves, and have peace one with another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he arose from thence, and went into the coasts of Judea by the far side of Jordan, and the people resorted unto him again, and as he was wont, he taught them again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees came and asked him, if it were lawful for a man to put away his wife, and tempted him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered, and said unto them, What did Moses command you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to put her away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, and said unto them, For the hardness of your heart he wrote this precept unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at the beginning of the creation God made them male and female:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this cause shall man leave his father and mother, and cleave unto his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they twain shall be one flesh: so that they are no more twain, but one flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, what God hath coupled together, let not man separate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the house his disciples asked him again of that matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, whosoever shall put away his wife and marry another, commiteth adultery against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a woman put away her husband, and be married to another, she commiteth adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought little children to him, that he should touch them, and his disciples rebuked those that brought them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus saw it, he was displeased, and said to them, Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall not enter therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took them up in his arms, and put his hands upon them, and blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was gone out on the way, there came one running, and kneeled to him, and asked him, Good Master, what shall I do, that I may possess eternal life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, Why callest thou me good? there is none good but one, even God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou knowest the commandments, Thou shalt not commit adultery. Thou shalt not kill. Thou shalt not steal. Thou shalt not bear false witness. Thou shalt hurt no man. Honor thy father and mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he answered, and said to him, Master, all these things have I observed from my youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus looked upon him, and loved him, and said unto him, One thing is lacking unto thee. Go and sell all that thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven, and come, follow me, and take up the cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he was sad at that saying, and went away sorrowful: for he had great possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus looked round about, and said unto his disciples, How hardly do they that have riches, enter into the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples were afraid at his words. But Jesus answered again, and said unto them, Children, how hard is it for them that trust in riches, to enter into the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were much more astonied, saying with themselves, Who then can be saved?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus looked upon them, and said, With men it is impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have forsaken all, and have followed thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, and said, Verily I say unto you, there is no man that hath forsaken house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands for my sake and the Gospels,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he shall receive an hundredfold, now at this present, houses, and brethren, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands with persecutions, and in the world to come, eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many that are first, shall be last, and the last, first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus went before them, and they were troubled, and as they followed, they were afraid, and Jesus took the twelve again, and began to tell them what things should come unto him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the high Priests, and to the Scribes, and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall mock him, and scourge him, and spit upon him, and kill him: but the third day he shall rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then James and John the sons of Zebedee came unto him, saying, Master, we would that thou shouldest do for us that we desire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, What would ye I should do for you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, Grant unto us, that we may sit, one at thy right hand, and the other at thy left hand in thy glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said unto them, Ye know not what ye ask. Can ye drink of the cup that I shall drink of, and be baptized with the baptism that I shall be baptized with?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto him, We can. But Jesus said unto them, Ye shall drink indeed of the cup that I shall drink of, and be baptized with the baptism wherewith I shall be baptized:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to sit at my right hand and at my left, is not mine to give, but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the ten heard that, they began to disdain at James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called them unto him, and said to them, Ye know that they which are princes among the Gentiles, have domination over them, and they that be great among them, exercise authority over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it shall not be so among you: but whosoever will be great among you, shall be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever will be chief of you, shall be the servant of all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even the Son of man came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life for the ransom of many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to Jericho: and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples, and a great multitude, Bartimaeus the son of Timaeus, a blind man, sat by the wayside, begging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry, and to say, Jesus the Son of David, have mercy on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many rebuked him, because he should hold his peace: but he cried much more, O Son of David, have mercy on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus stood still, and commanded him to be called: and they called the blind, saying unto him, Be of good comfort: arise, he calleth thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he threw away his cloak, and rose, and came to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said unto him, What wilt thou that I do unto thee? And the blind said unto him, Lord, that I may receive sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto him, Go thy way: thy faith hath saved thee. And by and by he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came near to Jerusalem, to Bethphage and Bethany unto the mount of Olives, he sent forth two of his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto them, Go your ways into that town that is over against you, and as soon as ye shall enter into it, ye shall find a colt tied, whereon never man sat: loose him, and bring him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if any man say unto you, Why do ye this? Say that the Lord hath need of him, and straightway he will send him hither.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went their way, and found a colt, tied by the door without, in a place where two ways met, and they loosed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then certain of them, that stood there, said unto them, What do ye loosing the colt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto them, as Jesus had commanded them: So they let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought the colt to Jesus, and cast their garments on him, and he sat upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many spread their garments in the way: others cut down branches off the trees, and strawed them in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that went before, and they that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna: blessed be he that cometh in the Name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the kingdom that cometh in the Name of the Lord of our father David: Hosanna, O thou which art in the highest heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus entered into Jerusalem, and into the Temple: and when he had looked about on all things, and now it was evening, he went forth unto Bethany with the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the morrow when they were come out from Bethany, he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seeing a fig tree afar off, that had leaves, he went to see if he might find anything thereon: but when he came unto it, he found nothing but leaves: for the time of figs was not yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, and said to it, Never man eat fruit of thee hereafter while the world standeth: and his disciples heard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Jerusalem, and Jesus went into the Temple, and began to cast out them that sold and bought in the Temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither would he suffer that any man should carry a vessel through the Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he taught, saying unto them, Is it not written, Mine house shall be called the house of prayer unto all nations? but you have made it a den of thieves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Scribes and high Priests heard it, and sought how to destroy him: for they feared him, because the whole multitude was astonied at his doctrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when even was come, Jesus went out of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning as they journeyed together, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter remembered, and said unto him, Master, behold, the fig tree which thou cursedst, is withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said unto them, Have the faith of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For verily I say unto you, that whosoever shall say unto this mountain, Be thou taken away, and cast into the sea, and shall not waver in his heart, but shall believe that those things which he saith, shall come to pass, whatsoever he saith, shall be done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I say unto you, Whatsoever ye desire when ye pray, believe that ye shall have it, and it shall be done unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when ye shall stand, and pray, forgive, if ye have anything against any man, that your Father also which is in heaven, may forgive you your trespasses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you will not forgive, your Father which is in heaven, will not pardon you your trespasses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came again to Jerusalem: and as he walked in the Temple, there came to him the high Priests, and the Scribes, and the Elders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority, that thou shouldest do these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, and said unto them, I will also ask you a certain thing, and answer ye me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men? answer me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they thought with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven, he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, Of men, we fear the people: for all men counted John that he was a Prophet indeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they answered, and said unto Jesus, We cannot tell. And Jesus answered, and said unto them, Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to speak unto them in parables, A certain man planted a vineyard, and compassed it with an hedge, and dug a pit for the winepress, and built a tower in it, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a strange country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the time, he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he might receive of the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they took him, and beat him, and sent him away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he sent unto them another servant, and at him they cast stones, and brake his head, and sent him away shamefully handled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he sent another, and him they slew, and many others, beating some, and killing some.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet had he one son, his dear beloved: him also he sent the last unto them, saying, They will reverence my son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the husbandmen said among themselves, This is the heir: come, let us kill him, and the inheritance shall be ours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took him, and killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What shall then the Lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy these husbandmen, and give the vineyard to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have ye not read so much as this Scripture, The stone which the builders did refuse, is made the head of the corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was done of the Lord, and it is marvelous in our eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went about to take him, but they feared the people: for they perceived that he spake that parable against them: therefore they left him, and went their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sent unto him certain of the Pharisees, and of the Herodians, that they might take him in his talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came, they said unto him, Master, we know that thou art true, and carest for no man: for thou considerest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God truly, Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar, or not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should we give it, or should we not give it? but he knew their hypocrisy, and said unto them, Why tempt ye me? Bring me a penny, that I may see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought it, and he said unto them, Whose is this image and superscription? and they said unto him, Caesar’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, and said unto them, Give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God, those that are God’s: and they marveled at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the Sadducees unto him, (which say, there is no resurrection) and they asked him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Master, Moses wrote unto us, If any man’s brother die, and leave his wife, and leave no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were seven brethren, and the first took a wife, and when he died, left no issue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the second took her, and he died, neither did he yet leave issue, and the third likewise:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So these seven had her, and left no issue: last of all the wife died also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the resurrection then, when they shall rise again, whose wife shall she be of them? for seven had her to wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, and said unto them, Are ye not therefore deceived, because ye know not the Scriptures, neither the power of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when they shall rise again from the dead, neither men marry, nor wives are married, but are as the Angels which are in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as touching the dead, that they shall rise again, have ye not read in the book of Moses how in the bush God spake unto him, saying, I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living. Ye are therefore greatly deceived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came one of the Scribes that had heard them disputing together, and perceiving that he had answered them well, he asked him, Which is the first commandment of all?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, The first of all the commandments is, Hear, Israel, The Lord our God is the only Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt therefore love the Lord thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind, and with all thy strength: this is the first commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second is like, that is, Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself. There is none other commandment greater than these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then that Scribe said unto him, Well, Master, thou hast said the truth, that there is one God, and that there is none but he,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, and with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbor as himself, is more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly, he said unto him, Thou art not far from the kingdom of God. And no man after that durst ask him any question.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said teaching in the Temple, How say the Scribes that Christ is the son of David?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David himself said by the holy Ghost, The Lord said to my Lord, Sit at my right hand, till I make thine enemies thy footstool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David himself calleth him Lord: by what means is he then his son? and much people heard him gladly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover he said unto them in his doctrine, Beware of the Scribes which love to go in long robes, and love salutations in the markets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief seats in the Synagogues, and the first rooms at feasts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which devour widows’ houses, even under a color of long prayers. These shall receive the greater damnation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Jesus sat over against the treasury, he beheld how the people cast money into the treasury, and many rich men cast in much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came a certain poor widow, and she threw in two mites, which make a quadrin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called unto him his disciples, and said unto them, Verily I say unto you, that this poor widow hath cast more in, than all they which have cast into the treasury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they all did cast in of their superfluity: but she of her poverty did cast in all that she had, even all her living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he went out of the Temple, one of his disciples said unto him, Master, see what manner stones, and what manner buildings are here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered and said unto him, Seest thou these great buildings? there shall not be left one stone upon a stone, that shall not be thrown down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he sat on the mount of Olives, over against the Temple, Peter, and James, and John, and Andrew asked him secretly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell us, when shall these things be? and what shall be the sign when all these things shall be fulfilled?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered them, and began to say, Take heed lest any man deceive you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
