verses.text: For many shall come in my Name, saying, I am Christ, and shall deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore when ye shall hear of wars, and rumors of wars, be ye not troubled, for such things must needs be: but the end shall not be yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom, and there shall be earthquakes in divers quarters, and there shall be famine and troubles: these are the beginnings of sorrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But take ye heed to yourselves: for they shall deliver you up to the Councils, and to the Synagogues: ye shall be beaten, and brought before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimonial unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Gospel must first be published among all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they lead you, and deliver you up, be not careful before hand, neither study what ye shall say: but what is given you at the same time, that speak: for it is not you that speak, but the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, and the brother shall deliver the brother to death, and the father the son, and the children shall rise against their parents, and shall cause them to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my Name’s sake: but whosoever shall endure unto the end, he shall be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, when ye shall see the abomination of desolation (spoken of by Daniel the Prophet) set where it ought not, (let him that readeth, consider it) then let them that be in Judea, flee into the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let him that is upon the house, not come down into the house, neither enter therein, to fetch anything out of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let him that is in the field, not turn back again to take his garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then woe shall be to them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray therefore that your flight be not in the winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For those days shall be such tribulation, as was not from the beginning of the creation which God created unto this time, neither shall be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And except that the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh should be saved: but for the elect’s sake, which he hath chosen, he hath shortened those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then if any man say to you, Lo, here is Christ, or lo, he is there, believe it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For false Christs shall rise, and false prophets, and shall show signs and wonders, to deceive if it were possible the very elect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But take ye heed: behold, I have showed you all things before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover in those days, after that tribulation, the sun shall wax dark, and the moon shall not give her light,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the stars of heaven shall fall: and the powers which are in heaven, shall shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then shall they see the Son of man, coming in the clouds, with great power and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall then send his Angels, and shall gather together his elect from the four winds, and from the utmost part of the earth to the utmost part of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now learn a parable of the fig tree. When her bough is yet tender, and it bringeth forth leaves, ye know that summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So in like manner, when ye see these things come to pass, know that the kingdom of God is near, even at the doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, that this generation shall not pass, till all these things be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But of that day and hour knoweth no man, no, not the Angels which are in heaven, neither the Son himself, but the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed: watch, and pray: for ye know not when the time is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of man is as a man going into a strange country, and leaveth his house, and giveth authority to his servants, and to every man his work, and commandeth the porter to watch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch ye therefore, (for ye know not when the master of the house will come, at even, or at midnight, at the cock crowing, or in the dawning,)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lest if he come suddenly, he should find you sleeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those things that I say unto you, I say unto all men, Watch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And two days after followed the feast of the Passover, and of unleavened bread: and the high Priests, and Scribes sought how they might take him by craft, and put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, Not in the feast day, lest there be any tumult among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at table, there came a woman having a box of ointment of Spikenard, very costly, and she brake the box, and poured it on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore some disdained among themselves, and said, To what end is this waste of ointment?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it might have been sold for more than three hundred pence, and been given unto the poor, and they murmured against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, Let her alone: Why trouble ye her? she hath wrought a good work on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye have the poor with you always, and when ye will ye may do them good, but me ye shall not have always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She hath done that she could: she came aforehand to anoint my body to the burying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, wheresoever this Gospel shall be preached throughout the whole world, this also that she hath done, shall be spoken of in remembrance of her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went away unto the high Priests, to betray him unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard it, they were glad, and promised that they would give him money: therefore he sought how he might conveniently betray him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the first day of unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the Passover, his disciples said unto him, Where wilt thou that we go and prepare, that thou mayest eat the Passover?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent forth two of his disciples, and said unto them, Go ye into the city, and there shall a man meet you bearing a pitcher of water: follow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whithersoever he goeth in, say ye to the good man of the house, The master saith, Where is the lodging where I shall eat the Passover with my disciples?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will show you an upper chamber which is large, trimmed and prepared: there make it ready for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So his disciples went forth, and came to the city, and found as he had said unto them, and made ready the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at even he came with the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they sat at table and did eat, Jesus said, Verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me, which eateth with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they began to be sorrowful and to say to him one by one, Is it I? And another, Is it I?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said unto them, It is one of the twelve that dippeth with me in the platter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly the Son of man goeth his way, as it is written of him: but woe be to that man, by whom the Son of man is betrayed: it had been good for that man, if he had never been born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they did eat, Jesus took the bread, and when he had given thanks, he brake it and gave it to them, and said, Take, eat, this is my body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also he took the cup, and when he had given thanks, gave it to them: and they all drank of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, This is my blood of that new Testament which is shed for many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine until that day, that I drink it new in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had sung a Psalm, they went out to the mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, All ye shall be offended by me this night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after that I am risen, I will go into Galilee before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said unto him, Although all men should be offended at thee, yet would not I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, this day, even in this night before the cock crow twice, thou shalt deny me thrice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said more earnestly, If I should die with thee, I will not deny thee: likewise also said they all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After, they came into a place named Gethsemane: then he said to his disciples, Sit ye here, till I have prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took with him Peter, and James, and John, and he began to be troubled, and in great heaviness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto them, My soul is very heavy, even unto the death: tarry here, and watch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went forward a little, and fell down on the ground, and prayed, that if it were possible, that hour might pass from him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Abba, Father, all things are possible unto thee: take away this cup from me: nevertheless not that I will, but that thou wilt, be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came, and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, Simon, sleepest thou? couldest not thou watch one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch ye, and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeed is ready, but the flesh is weak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he went away, and prayed, and spake the same words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he returned, and found them asleep again: for their eyes were heavy: neither knew they what they should answer him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came the third time, and said unto them, Sleep henceforth, and take your rest: it is enough: the hour is come: behold, the Son of man is delivered into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rise up: let us go: lo, he that betrayeth me, is at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately while he yet spake, came Judas that was one of the twelve, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves from the high Priests, and Scribes, and Elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that betrayed him, had given them a token, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, he it is: take him and lead him away safely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as he was come, he went straightway to him, and said, Hail Master, and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they laid their hands on him, and took him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them that stood by, drew out a sword, and smote a servant of the high Priest, and cut off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said to them, Ye be come out as against a thief, with swords and with staves, to take me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was daily with you, teaching in the Temple, and ye took me not: but this is done that the Scriptures should be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they all forsook him, and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there followed him a certain young man, clothed in linen upon his bare body, and the young men caught him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he left his linen cloth, and fled from them naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they led Jesus away to the high Priest, and to him came together all the high Priests, and the Elders, and the Scribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter followed him afar off, even into the hall of the high Priest, and sat with the servants, and warmed himself at the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the high Priests, and all the Council sought for witness against Jesus, to put him to death, but found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many bare false witness against him, but their witness agreed not together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there arose certain, and bare false witness against him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We heard him say, I will destroy this Temple made with hands, and within three days I will build another, made without hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their witness yet agreed not together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high Priest stood up amongst them, and asked Jesus, saying, Answerest thou nothing? what is the matter that these bear witness against thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he held his peace, and answered nothing. Again the high Priest asked him, and said unto him, Art thou that Christ the son of the Blessed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, I am he, and ye shall see the Son of man sit at the right hand of the power of God, and come in the clouds of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high Priest rent his clothes, and said, What have we anymore need of witnesses?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye have heard the blasphemy: what think ye? And they all condemned him to be worthy of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some began to spit at him, and to cover his face, and to beat him with fists, and to say unto him, Prophesy. And the sergeants smote him with their rods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Peter was beneath in the hall, there came one of the maids of the high Priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she saw Peter warming himself, she looked on him, and said, Thou wast also with Jesus of Nazareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it, saying, I know him not, neither wot I what thou sayest. Then he went out into the porch, and the cock crew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a maid saw him again, and began to say to them that stood by, This is one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it again: and anon after, they that stood by, said again to Peter, Surely thou art one of them: for thou art of Galilee, and thy speech is like.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to curse, and swear, saying, I know not this man of whom ye speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the second time the cock crew, and Peter remembered the word that Jesus had said unto him, Before the cock crow twice, thou shalt deny me thrice, and weighing that with himself, he wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And anon in the dawning, the high Priests held a Council with the Elders, and the Scribes, and the whole Council, and bound Jesus, and led him away, and delivered him to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate asked him, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered, and said unto him, Thou sayest it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the high Priests accused him of many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore Pilate asked him again, saying, Answered thou nothing? behold how many things they witness against thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered no more at all, so that Pilate marveled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the feast, Pilate did deliver a prisoner unto them, whomsoever they would desire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there was one named Barabbas, which was bound with his fellows, that had made insurrection, who in the insurrection had committed murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people cried aloud, and began to desire that he would do as he had ever done unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate answered them, and said, Will ye that I let loose unto you the King of the Jews?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he knew that the high Priests had delivered him of envy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the high Priests had moved the people to desire that he would rather deliver Barabbas unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate answered, and said again unto them, What will ye then that I do with him, whom ye call the King of the Jews?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cried again, Crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said unto them, But what evil hath he done? And they cried the more fervently, Crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate willing to content the people, loosed them Barabbas, and delivered Jesus, when he had scourged him, that he might be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers led him away into the hall, which is the common hall, and called together the whole band,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And clad him with purple, and platted a crown of thorns, and put it about his head,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And began to salute him, saying, Hail, King of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they smote him on the head with a reed, and spat upon him, and bowed the knees, and did him reverence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had mocked him, they took the purple off him, and put his own clothes on him, and led him out to crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they compelled one that passed by, called Simon of Cyrene (which came out of the country, and was father of Alexander and Rufus) to bear his cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought him to a place named Golgotha, which is by interpretation, the place of dead mens’ skulls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh: but he received it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had crucified him, they parted his garments, casting lots for them, what every man should have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was the third hour when they crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the title of his cause was written above, THAT KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They crucified also with him two thieves, the one on the right hand, and the other on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the Scripture was fulfilled, which saith, And he was counted among the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that went by, railed on him, wagging their heads, and saying, Hey, thou that destroyest the Temple, and buildest it in three days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Save thyself, and come down from the cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise also even the high Priests mocking, said among themselves with the Scribes, He saved other men, himself he cannot save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let Christ the king of Israel now come down from the cross, that we may see, and believe. They also that were crucified with him, reviled him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the sixth hour was come, darkness arose over all the land until the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eloi, Eloi, lama-sabachthani? which is by interpretation, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of them that stood by, when they heard it, said, Behold, he calleth Elijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one ran, and filled a sponge full of vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let him alone: let us see if Elijah will come, and take him down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus cried with a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the veil of the Temple was rent in twain, from the top to the bottom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Centurion, which stood over against him, saw that he thus crying gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were also women which beheld afar off, among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less, and of Joses, and Salome,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which also when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him, and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now when the night was come (because it was the day of the preparation that is before the Sabbath)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph of Arimathea, an honorable counselor, which also looked for the kingdom of God, came, and went in boldly unto Pilate, and asked the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate marveled, if he were already dead, and called unto him the Centurion, and asked of him whether he had been any while dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he knew the truth of the Centurion, he gave the body to Joseph:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who bought a linen cloth, and took him down, and wrapped him in the linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb that was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulcher:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary Magdalene, and Mary Joses’ mother, beheld where he should be laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Sabbath day was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Salome, bought sweet ointments, that they might come and anoint him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore early in the morning, the first day of the week, they came unto the sepulcher, when the Sun was now risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said one to another, Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the sepulcher?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they looked, they saw that the stone was rolled away (for it was a very great one)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went into the sepulcher, and saw a young man sitting at the right side, clothed in a long white robe: and they were sore troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto them, Be not so troubled: ye seek Jesus of Nazareth, which hath been crucified: he is risen, he is not here: behold the place where they put him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But go your way, and tell his disciples, and Peter, that he will go before you into Galilee: there shall ye see him, as he said unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went out quickly, and fled from the sepulcher: for they trembled, and were amazed: neither said they anything to any man: for they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus was risen again, early the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had cast seven devils:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she went and told them that had been with him, which mourned and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard that he was alive, and had appeared to her, they believed it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, he appeared unto two of them in another form, as they walked and went into the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went and told it to the remnant, neither believed they them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, he appeared unto the eleven as they sat together, and reproached them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they believed not them which had seen him, being risen up again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Go ye into all the world, and preach the Gospel to every creature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that shall believe and be baptized, shall be saved: but he that will not believe, shall be damned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these tokens shall follow them that believe, In my Name they shall cast out devils, and shall speak with new tongues,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And shall take away serpents, and if they shall drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them: they shall lay their hands on the sick, and they shall recover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after the Lord had spoken unto them, he was received into heaven, and sat at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went forth, and preached everywhere. And the Lord wrought with them, and confirmed the word with signs that followed. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
